results.title: The Australian Government System
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Public Service Board and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Provides a broad description of the Australian Government System. Addresses the legislative arm of government including the Governor General, the Senate and House of Representatives. Overviews the executive arm of Government including the Executive Council. Introduces Departments, Authorities and the Federal Judiciary including both the High Court and Family Court of Australia.

results.title: The Australian Bicentennial Golf Classic
results.brief_description: The prestigious and classic Australian golfing event, held at the Royal Melbourne Golf course, is one of Australia’s most important Bicentennial sports event. A sensational field of competitors compete for the highest prize money ever offered in an Australian golfing event. The world’s number one golfer, and one of Australia’s greatest sportsmen, Greg Norman, pairs head to head against “Golfer of the Century” Jack Nicklaus. Includes Roger Davis, Nick Faldo and many more of golf’s champion players.

results.title: The Australian ballet: opening act 1962-1972
results.creator_credit: Michelle Potter, Sally Jackson, National Library of Australia and ScreenSound Australia
results.brief_description: It was a fortuitous evening when Harold Holt, then federal treasurer, approached Peggy van Praagh and advised her the he could provide the financial means to establish what would become Australia’s first national ballet company. The season opened in 1962 with a performance of Swan Lake at Her Majesty’s Theatre in Sydney and featured 40 dancers, chiefly comprised from the Borovansky ballet company, that van Praagh took over on the death of its titular founder. The company toured Australia, introducing delighted audiences to the classics, innovative pieces and new choreography including Melbourne Cup, and The Display and Yugen by Sir Robert Helpmann who would later join van Praagh as co-artistic director. Helpmann and van Praag represented two sides of the artistic coin - Helpmann a flamboyant promoter of the ballet without being actively involved in the day to day running, and van Praag, the English teacher and educator who maintained a strong bond between the company and her mother country. Introduced by Barry Kitcher and narrated by Helen Vaughan Roberts, this program presents archival footage of performances, highlights of international guests such as Sonia Arova, Erik Bruhn, Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev, original pieces from the 1950s, biographical information about Helpmann and van Praag and profiles Australian artists including Marilyn Rowe and Kelvin Coe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michelle Potter, Sally Jackson, National Library of Australia and ScreenSound Australia

results.title: The Australian AIDS tape
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Sabina Wynn, Health Media and Education Centre and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: Aimed at the general community and provides factual information about AIDS. What HIV/AIDS is. How HIV is transmitted. How HIV is not transmitted. How to prevent it. What to do if you are worried. Offers a telephone number in each State which people can call for further information. A current affair style approach with animation and graphics is used. It was developed for use by educators but can stand alone as an educational resource if no AIDS educator is available. Presented by Geraldine Doogue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Torrens, Sabina Wynn, Health Media and Education Centre and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: The Audition
results.creator_credit: C B Wismar and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: A young man comes into a seemingly empty theatre for an audition. He is not given a script but it is clear to the invisible director that he can portray surprise & anger can he portray love? Understanding? Pity? Concern? An allegorical tale of life, the young man it appears is the director as well.

results.title: The Au Harem D'archimede = Tea in the harem
results.brief_description:
“The narrative centers on the adventures of a couple of eighteen-year-olds, Madjid, a Beur and Pat, his illiterate French friend. However, the loose episodic structure of the narrative, covering a week or so in the lives of people living on the ironically named Flowers Estate, allows other stories to be intercalated, particularly that of Josette, a single mother who loses her job and is driven to attempt suicide, and Malika, Madjid’s mother, who not only holds her own family together, but also provides support for other women on the estate who are unable to cope. The film is primarily interested in exploring Madjid’s conflicts of identity, torn between the (unrealistic) expectations his mother has of him as an Algerian and his experiences on the streets of Paris with Pat.” Reference: Carrie Tarr. Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the Harem’ to ‘Cheb’. Screen 34:4 (Winter 1993).Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1984.

Credits: Producer, Michele Ray-Gavras ; director, Mehdi Charef ; writer, Mehdi Charef ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Karim Kacel
Cast: Kader Boukhanef, Remi Martin, Laure Duthilleul, Saida Bekkouche, Nicole Hiss.

results.title: The Atomic Cafe
results.creator_credit: Pierce Rafferty, Jayne Loader, Kevin Rafferty and Archives Project Production Co
results.brief_description: A painstakingly researched and brilliantly edited compendium of pro-nuclear propaganda from American newsreels, ‘educational’ material, military footage, advertisements, TV shows and pop songs. This was the Cold War at its most icy and all-pervasive, and no area of American popular culture seems to have escaped from its bitter ideological grip. This veritable flood of bizarre, horrifying and often ludicrously comic images is counterpointed on the soundtrack by an array of equally extraordinary songs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierce Rafferty, Jayne Loader, Kevin Rafferty and Archives Project Production Co

results.title: The Atom: a closer look
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Corporate Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to illustrate the history of atomic theory, the structure of the atom and its nucleus, how nuclear energy is generated, radiation and the problems of nuclear waste disposal. Although basically factual, the program stresses the fact that the atom is neither good nor evil, and that it is man’s responsibility to decide whether atomic power will either create or destroy. Made pre Chernobyl but an excellent introduction to atomic theory. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
